Create Privilege Set

Use the Create Privilege Set dialog box (Admin | Security | Privilege Sets | Add button) to create a new privilege set in an access control database.

Field Descriptions

Name Enter the name of the new privilege set. The name cannot begin or end with a tab or blank space. Any character can be used in the name except * : \ ' " ( ).
Privilege sets Select the privilege sets that will define this new privilege set.
All privileges Select the base privileges and composite privileges that will be part of the definition of this new privilege set. The options with a + beside them are allowed. The options with a - beside them negative privileges. The - means that the privilege is denied. If a Project privilege is denied to a user, it cannot be allowed in a privilege set that is assigned to the user. For example, if the Create Project privilege is denied as a base privilege to a user but is allowed in a privilege set that is assigned to the same user, the user does not have the Create Project privilege.

To change the status of an option, click the check box beside the option. You can allow or disallow an entire set of related privileges by clicking the parent option. For example, you could assign all of the Action privileges by clicking the check box beside Action Privileges to place a + in the check box.
Selected privileges Displays a cumulation of the privileges you have selected. If any of the Project privileges are allowed, they are not displayed in this box. They are only displayed in this box when they are denied because they are negative privileges.
Restrict by promotion group Enter the name of the promotion group that will restrict the privileges or click the Browse button to select one.

See Also
